frame.name: FR_Make_agreement
frame.definition:
<def-root>The <fen>Parties</fen> come to an agreement about something, be that an <fen>Opinion</fen> they share or an <fen>Obligation</fen> to be carried by one or both of them.
The <fen>Parties</fen> may be expressed separately, with <fen>Party_2</fen> being the basis for establishing the <fen>Opinion</fen> of <fen>Party_1</fen>. Rather than a specific <fen>Opinion</fen> or <fen>Obligation</fen>, a domain about which a similar or differing <fen>Opinion</fen> is held (or in which the <fen>Obligation</fen> applies), the <fen>Topic</fen>, may be specified.
<ex></ex> Distinctions with other frames: <ex></ex>
â‰ <frframe>FR_Make_agreement</frframe>: FR_Make_agreement is inchoative of Be_in_agreement.
</def-root>

FE.name: Party_1
FE.definition: <def-root>The individual or individuals that form the more prominent (i.e. agentive) party of the agreement, as compared with <fen>Party_2</fen>.</def-root>

FE.name: Party_2
FE.definition: <def-root>The semantically (and grammatically) less prominent participant (or group of participants) in the agreement.</def-root>

FE.name: Parties
FE.definition: <def-root>The group of individuals portrayed as equally involved in making an agreement. </def-root>

FE.name: Obligation
FE.definition:
<def-root>An expression of the commitment of the <fen>Parties</fen> .
</def-root>

FE.name: Opinion
FE.definition: <def-root>A state of affairs believed by the <fen>Parties</fen>. </def-root>
